page.title: 11RIVER ** NURSERY **
page.content:
{ THOUSANDS of CHRYSANTHEMUMS { { River Nursery}has four large {greenhouses}measuring 30 metres long.Their widths are 12.7m, 8.9m, 12.3m and 18m. The small propagating greenhouse measures 11.5m by 3.7m. When you leave the car-park there is an area of black polythene with Christmas trees growing through it.In three greenhouses there is room for 8,000 then 14,000 then 21,000 plants. {Mr.North}and{Mr.Rawlings}own the Nursery.{Mr.Paul Lawson}plants the seeds,measures the fertiliser,picks the flowers and packs them in sleeves and sends the fresh chrysanthemums to Covent Garden. Our class visited the nursery and saw all stages of growing.
Measured and written by {Charlotte {Lawson of Flat 1 River Nursery.
